00016 static Resource *DIOChannels = NULL;
00017 static Resource *DO_PWMGenerators[tDIO::kNumSystems] = {NULL};

00024 DigitalModule* DigitalModule::GetInstance(UINT32 slot)
00025 {
00026     if (CheckDigitalModule(slot))
00027     {
00028         if (m_modules[slot] == NULL)
00029         {
00030             m_modules[slot] = new DigitalModule(slot);
00031         }
00032         return (DigitalModule*)m_modules[slot];
00033     }
00034     return NULL;
00035 }
00036 
00037 UINT32 DigitalModule::SlotToIndex(UINT32 slot)
00038 {
00039     const UINT32 mapping[] = {0,0,0,0,0,1,0,0};
00040     return mapping[slot - 1];
00041 }
00042 
00051 DigitalModule::DigitalModule(UINT32 slot)
00052     : Module(slot)
00053     , m_fpgaDIO (NULL)
00054 {
00055     Resource::CreateResourceObject(&DIOChannels, tDIO::kNumSystems * kDigitalChannels);
00056     Resource::CreateResourceObject(&DO_PWMGenerators[SlotToIndex(m_slot)], tDIO::kNumDO_PWMDutyCycleElements);
00057     m_fpgaDIO = new tDIO(SlotToIndex(m_slot), &status);
00058 
00059     // Make sure that the 9403 IONode has had a chance to initialize before continuing.
00060     while(m_fpgaDIO->readLoopTiming(&status) == 0) taskDelay(1);
00061     if (m_fpgaDIO->readLoopTiming(&status) != kExpectedLoopTiming)
00062     {
00063         wpi_fatal(LoopTimingError);
00064         printf("DIO LoopTiming: %d, expecting: %d\n", m_fpgaDIO->readLoopTiming(&status), kExpectedLoopTiming);
00065     }
00066     m_fpgaDIO->writePWMConfig_Period(PWM::kDefaultPwmPeriod, &status);
00067     m_fpgaDIO->writePWMConfig_MinHigh(PWM::kDefaultMinPwmHigh, &status);
00068 
00069     // Ensure that PWM output values are set to OFF
00070     for (UINT32 pwm_index = 1; pwm_index <= kPwmChannels; pwm_index++)
00071     {
00072         SetPWM(pwm_index, PWM::kPwmDisabled);
00073         SetPWMPeriodScale(pwm_index, 3); // Set all to 4x by default.
00074     }
00075 
00076     // Turn off all relay outputs.
00077     m_fpgaDIO->writeSlowValue_RelayFwd(0, &status);
00078     m_fpgaDIO->writeSlowValue_RelayRev(0, &status);
00079 
00080     // Create a semaphore to protect changes to the relay values
00081     m_relaySemaphore = semMCreate(SEM_Q_PRIORITY | SEM_DELETE_SAFE | SEM_INVERSION_SAFE);
00082 
00083     AddToSingletonList();
00084 }
00085 
00086 DigitalModule::~DigitalModule()
00087 {
00088     semDelete(m_relaySemaphore);
00089     m_relaySemaphore = NULL;
00090     delete m_fpgaDIO;
00091     m_modules[m_slot] = NULL;
00092 }

00101 void DigitalModule::SetPWM(UINT32 channel, UINT8 value)
00102 {
00103     CheckPWMChannel(channel);
00104     m_fpgaDIO->writePWMValue(channel - 1, value, &status);
00105 }
00106 
00113 UINT8 DigitalModule::GetPWM(UINT32 channel)
00114 {
00115     CheckPWMChannel(channel);
00116     return m_fpgaDIO->readPWMValue(channel - 1, &status);
00117 }

00125 void DigitalModule::SetPWMPeriodScale(UINT32 channel, UINT32 squelchMask)
00126 {
00127     CheckPWMChannel(channel);
00128     m_fpgaDIO->writePWMPeriodScale(channel - 1, squelchMask, &status);
00129 }

00136 void DigitalModule::SetRelayForward(UINT32 channel, bool on)
00137 {
00138     status = 0;
00139     CheckRelayChannel(channel);
00140     {
00141         Synchronized sync(m_relaySemaphore);
00142         UINT8 forwardRelays = m_fpgaDIO->readSlowValue_RelayFwd(&status);
00143         if (on)
00144             forwardRelays |= 1 << (channel - 1);
00145         else
00146             forwardRelays &= ~(1 << (channel - 1));
00147         m_fpgaDIO->writeSlowValue_RelayFwd(forwardRelays, &status);
00148     }
00149     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00150 }
00151 
00157 void DigitalModule::SetRelayReverse(UINT32 channel, bool on)
00158 {
00159     status = 0;
00160     CheckRelayChannel(channel);
00161     {
00162         Synchronized sync(m_relaySemaphore);
00163         UINT8 reverseRelays = m_fpgaDIO->readSlowValue_RelayRev(&status);
00164         if (on)
00165             reverseRelays |= 1 << (channel - 1);
00166         else
00167             reverseRelays &= ~(1 << (channel - 1));
00168         m_fpgaDIO->writeSlowValue_RelayRev(reverseRelays, &status);
00169     }
00170     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00171 }
00172 
00176 bool DigitalModule::GetRelayForward(UINT32 channel)
00177 {
00178     status = 0;
00179     UINT8 forwardRelays = m_fpgaDIO->readSlowValue_RelayFwd(&status);
00180     return (forwardRelays & (1 << (channel - 1))) != 0;
00181 }

00218 bool DigitalModule::AllocateDIO(UINT32 channel, bool input)
00219 {
00220     status = 0;
00221     DIOChannels->Allocate(kDigitalChannels * SlotToIndex(m_slot) + channel - 1);
00222     UINT32 outputEnable = m_fpgaDIO->readOutputEnable(&status);
00223     UINT32 bitToSet = 1 << (RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1));
00224     UINT32 outputEnableValue;
00225     if (input)
00226     {
00227         outputEnableValue = outputEnable & (~ bitToSet ); // clear the bit for read
00228     }
00229     else
00230     {
00231         outputEnableValue = outputEnable | bitToSet; // set the bit for write
00232     }
00233     m_fpgaDIO->writeOutputEnable(outputEnableValue, &status);
00234     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00235     return true;
00236 }
00237 
00241 void DigitalModule::FreeDIO(UINT32 channel)
00242 {
00243     DIOChannels->Free(kDigitalChannels * SlotToIndex(m_slot) + channel - 1);
00244 }
00245 
00250 void DigitalModule::SetDIO(UINT32 channel, short value)
00251 {
00252     status = 0;
00253     if (value != 0 && value != 1)
00254     {
00255         wpi_fatal(NonBinaryDigitalValue);
00256         if (value != 0)
00257             value = 1;
00258     }
00259     UINT16 currentDIO = m_fpgaDIO->readDO(&status);
00260     if(value == 0)
00261     {
00262         currentDIO = currentDIO & ~(1 << RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1));
00263     }
00264     else if (value == 1)
00265     {
00266         currentDIO = currentDIO | (1 << RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1));
00267     } 
00268     m_fpgaDIO->writeDO(currentDIO, &status);
00269     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00270 }
00271 
00276 bool DigitalModule::GetDIO(UINT32 channel)
00277 {
00278     status = 0;
00279     UINT32 currentDIO = m_fpgaDIO->readDI(&status);
00280     
00281     //Shift 00000001 over channel-1 places.
00282     //AND it against the currentDIO
00283     //if it == 0, then return false
00284     //else return true
00285     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00286     return ((currentDIO >> RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1)) & 1) != 0;
00287 }
00288 
00293 UINT16 DigitalModule::GetDIO(void)
00294 {
00295     status = 0;
00296     return m_fpgaDIO->readDI(&status);
00297 }

00303 bool DigitalModule::GetDIODirection(UINT32 channel)
00304 {
00305     status = 0;
00306     UINT32 currentOutputEnable = m_fpgaDIO->readOutputEnable(&status);
00307     
00308     //Shift 00000001 over channel-1 places.
00309     //AND it against the currentOutputEnable
00310     //if it == 0, then return false
00311     //else return true
00312     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00313     return ((currentOutputEnable >> RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1)) & 1) != 0;
00314 }

00324     return m_fpgaDIO->readOutputEnable(&status);
00325 }

00331 void DigitalModule::Pulse(UINT32 channel, float pulseLength)
00332 {
00333     UINT16 mask = 1 << RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1);
00334     m_fpgaDIO->writePulseLength((UINT8)(1.0e9 * pulseLength / (m_fpgaDIO->readLoopTiming(&status) * 25)), &status);
00335     m_fpgaDIO->writePulse(mask, &status);
00336     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00337 }
00338 
00342 bool DigitalModule::IsPulsing(UINT32 channel)
00343 {
00344     UINT16 mask = 1 << RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1);
00345     UINT16 pulseRegister = m_fpgaDIO->readPulse(&status);
00346     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00347     return (pulseRegister & mask) != 0;
00348 }
00349 
00353 bool DigitalModule::IsPulsing()
00354 {
00355     UINT16 pulseRegister = m_fpgaDIO->readPulse(&status);
00356     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00357     return pulseRegister != 0;
00358 }

00365 {

00372 void DigitalModule::FreeDO_PWM(UINT32 pwmGenerator)
00373 {
00374     if (pwmGenerator == ~0ul) return;
00375     DO_PWMGenerators[SlotToIndex(m_slot)]->Free(pwmGenerator);
00376 }

00385 void DigitalModule::SetDO_PWMRate(float rate)
00386 {
00387     // Currently rounding in the log rate domain... heavy weight toward picking a higher freq.
00388     // TODO: Round in the linear rate domain.
00389     UINT8 pwmPeriodPower = (UINT8)(log(1.0 / (m_fpgaDIO->readLoopTiming(&status) * 0.25E-6 * rate))/log(2.0) + 0.5);
00390     m_fpgaDIO->writeDO_PWMConfig_PeriodPower(pwmPeriodPower, &status);
00391     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00392 }
00393 
00399 void DigitalModule::SetDO_PWMOutputChannel(UINT32 pwmGenerator, UINT32 channel)
00400 {
00401     if (pwmGenerator == ~0ul) return;
00402     switch(pwmGenerator)
00403     {
00404     case 0:
00405         m_fpgaDIO->writeDO_PWMConfig_OutputSelect_0(RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1), &status);
00406         break;
00407     case 1:
00408         m_fpgaDIO->writeDO_PWMConfig_OutputSelect_1(RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1), &status);
00409         break;
00410     case 2:
00411         m_fpgaDIO->writeDO_PWMConfig_OutputSelect_2(RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1), &status);
00412         break;
00413     case 3:
00414         m_fpgaDIO->writeDO_PWMConfig_OutputSelect_3(RemapDigitalChannel(channel - 1), &status);
00415         break;
00416     }
00417     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00418 }
00419 
00425 void DigitalModule::SetDO_PWMDutyCycle(UINT32 pwmGenerator, float dutyCycle)
00426 {
00427     if (pwmGenerator == ~0ul) return;
00428     if (dutyCycle > 1.0) dutyCycle = 1.0;
00429     if (dutyCycle < 0.0) dutyCycle = 0.0;
00430     float rawDutyCycle = 256.0 * dutyCycle;
00431     if (rawDutyCycle > 255.5) rawDutyCycle = 255.5;
00432     UINT8 pwmPeriodPower = m_fpgaDIO->readDO_PWMConfig_PeriodPower(&status);
00433     if (pwmPeriodPower < 4)
00434     {
00435         // The resolution of the duty cycle drops close to the highest frequencies.
00436         rawDutyCycle = rawDutyCycle / pow(2.0, 4 - pwmPeriodPower);
00437     }
00438     m_fpgaDIO->writeDO_PWMDutyCycle(pwmGenerator, (UINT8)rawDutyCycle, &status);
00439     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00440 }

00446 I2C* DigitalModule::GetI2C(UINT32 address)
00447 {
00448     return new I2C(this, address);
00449 }
